name: Romans Lesson 1
memoryVerse: “For I am not ashamed of the gospel, because it is the power of God that brings salvation to everyone who believes: first to the Jew, then to the Gentile.” – Romans 1:16

one.title: FIRST DAY: Read the notes and the references.

questions.questionText: 1. What was meaningful to you in the lecture?
2. What help did you receive from the notes?
3．What do you learn about Paul from his introduction?
4．The word “gospel” means “good news.” What news do these verses announce, why is it good, and how have you experienced this goodness?
5．How did Paul describe the Roman Christians, what did he offer them, and how do his words affect your attitude about yourself or other believers?
6．Whom did Paul thank, and why was he grateful?
7．What do you learn about the relationship between serving God and prayer?
8a．For what specifically did Paul pray, and how did God answer Paul’s prayer?
b．What do you learn about God from Paul’s prayers, and for whom or for what does this encourage you to pray?
9．Why did Paul want to come to the Roman church, and why had he not come previously?
10．How could Paul’s example help you when you face obstacles in serving God?
11．Why was Paul obligated to all people, and what was his attitude toward his obligation? What is your attitude toward your obligation to share your knowledge of Jesus with others?

five.title: FIFTH DAY: Read Romans 1:16-17. Note: These verses are the theme of the entire book of Romans.

questions.questionText: 12. List reasons Paul was not ashamed of the gospel.
13．In what situations are you tempted to be ashamed of the gospel, and how could Paul’s reasons help you?
14．How do these verses relate to your personal experience of the gospel, and how are they also Paul’s personal testimony?
15．What have you learned about God in this week’s study? How may your group pray for you as you make this truth a part of your life?
